summary: This is an email chain from December 4, 2020, regarding the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York sending a replacement hard drive to Ghislaine Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) after she broke her previous one. The email includes instructions for providing her access to the new drive and returning the broken one.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) who broke her hard drive and is being sent a replacement by the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Paralegal Specialist
persons.context: The individual at the U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY, to whom the broken drive should be mailed back.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The prosecutor from the Southern District of New York who is coordinating the delivery of the replacement hard drive to Maxwell and the return of the broken one.

connections.description: The prosecutor is managing evidence and materials for the defendant as part of the legal proceedings.
They work together at the U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY, handling case logistics.

events.title: Replacement Drive Sent to Maxwell
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends a replacement hard drive via FedEx to Ghislaine Maxwell at the MDC after she broke her previous one.

events.title: Email Coordination for Drive Delivery
events.description: Email correspondence confirms the shipment and provides instructions for giving Maxwell access to the new drive and returning the broken one.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell broke a hard drive while in custody at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) in late 2020.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York sent a replacement hard drive to Maxwell via FedEx on December 3, 2020.
The email includes a request for the broken drive to be mailed back to the U.S. Attorney's Office for evidence or disposal.
This correspondence shows logistical coordination between prosecutors and detention staff regarding Maxwell's access to case materials during her pre-trial detention.
